Deities, Faiths and Philosophies.name: Deities, Faiths and Philosophies
Deities, Faiths and Philosophies.description: Table of Deities, Faiths and Philosophies

Homeland.name: Homeland
Homeland.description:
Table of Homeland
For a dwarf, subtract 3; For an elf, add 2; For a Goblin, subtract 4. For non CRB ancestries the GM determines the modifier.

results.111-116: +3 greater striking Handwraps of Mighty Blows

Deck of Illusions Cards.name: Deck of Illusions Cards
Deck of Illusions Cards.description: Potential illusions drawn randomly from the deck. The card is destroyed on use.

results.1-1: Energy Unleashed (evocation) Raw energy deals 2d6 damage per spell level of the surge (basic Reflex save) in a 10-foot burst.
results.2-2: Positive Energy Expulsion (healing, necromancy, positive) Positive energy explodes outward, healing living creatures for 1d8 Hit Points per spell level of the surge in a 20-foot burst. Undead creatures instead take the same amount of positive damage, with a basic Will save.
results.3-3: Mass Siphon (transmutation) Creatures and objects within a 30-foot emanation become nearly weightless until the end of your next turn. Nearly weightless creatures can Climb at their land Speed and can Leap as far upward as they could normally Leap horizontally.
results.4-4: Magical Nemesis (conjuration, teleportation) A random creature connected to your magic (or inimical to it) appears within 60 feet. The creature should be of a level approximately equal to the level of an animal summoned by summon animal of the spell level, although it can be of any type. The GM determines the specific creature. The creature is unfriendly to you and friendly to your apparent enemies. After 1 minute, the creature can choose either to return where it came from or to remain. It is not summoned or a minion.
results.5-5: Monstrous Transformation (mental, morph, transmutation) Your head and arms transform into an exaggerated imitation of a creature connected to your magic for 1 minute. The GM determines the creature. You gain a status bonus to weapon and unarmed damage rolls equal to the spell level. At the start of each of your turns while you are transformed, you must succeed at a Will saving throw or be confused until the start of your next turn. On a critical success, you can choose to end the effect entirely, also losing the status bonus.
results.6-6: Sudden Gale (air, evocation) Weather in a 40-foot emanation is disturbed. Strong winds blow in a random direction for 1 minute. Each creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed at a Fortitude save or fall prone (and be pushed 10 feet on a critical failure), and you must succeed at this save immediately after the surge. Any movement against the wind is difficult terrain, or greater difficult terrain while flying.
results.7-7: Tremor (earth, evocation) The earth trembles in a 40-foot emanation. Each creature on a surface must immediately succeed at a Fortitude save or fall prone. The surface then becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute.
results.8-8: Oppressive Voice (divination, mental, nonlethal) The voice of your muse, your deity, an ancestor, or another appropriate entity suddenly overwhelms your mind. You must attempt a Will saving throw. You take 1d4 mental damage per spell level with a basic Will save. On a failure, you're also stunned 1 (stunned 2 on a critical failure).
results.9-9: Trinket Squall (illusion) Visual illusions of objects related to your magic fall like rain throughout a 40-foot burst for 1 minute, giving concealment in the area. Creatures can attempt to disbelieve this illusion.
results.10-10: Antimagic Eruption (abjuration) The surge attempts to counteract a random spell active on you and on each creature within a 10-foot burst.
results.11-11: Mental Broadcast (detection, divination, mental) For 1 minute, everyone within 30 feet of you can hear your surface thoughts.
results.12-12: Verdant Clutch (conjuration, plant) Plants and vines grow from all surfaces within 20 feet, causing all creatures in the area to be immobilized unless they succeed at a Reflex save. The Escape DC is equal to the spell DC.
results.13-13: Tinge of Terror (emotion, enchantment, fear, mental) All creatures within 20 feet are affected by powerful fright. They attempt a Will save, becoming frightened 1 on a failure or frightened 2 on a critical failure.
results.14-14: Strike up the Band (auditory, illusion) For 1 minute, you are followed by orchestral theme music tied to the emotional content of the actions you're performing. This grants you a +2 status bonus to Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks, a -2 status penalty to Deception checks, and makes certain uses of Stealth virtually impossible. It might have other effects as the GM sees fit.
results.15-15: Life Sap (necromancy) The surge drains your life force and strength. You become drained 1 and doomed 1, and you are enfeebled 2 for 1 minute.
results.16-16: Ablative Barrier (abjuration) Energy forms a protective barrier that ablates slowly as creatures in the area take damage. All creatures in a 40-foot burst gain resistance to all damage equal to double the surge's spell level for up to 1 minute. Whenever a creature applies this resistance, the resistance for all affected creatures reduces by 1. The effect ends for all creatures when it reduces to 0.
results.17-17: Luminous Pests (illusion, visual) Numerous tiny flying creatures formed of bright colorful light, such as bats or hummingbirds, emerge from you, flying in a 30-foot cone. You and all creatures in the cone must succeed at a Will save or be dazzled for 1 minute, or blinded for 1 round and then dazzled for 1 minute on a critical failure.
results.18-18: Emotional Turmoil (emotion, enchantment, mental) A swirl of conflicting emotions overwhelm you from the surging magic. For 1 minute, attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:11] at the start of each of your turns. On a success, you gain a +2 status bonus to all attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks; on a failure, you take a -2 status penalty to them instead.
results.19-19: Sudden Downpour (evocation, water) Water cascades from above, putting out non-magical fires in a 10-foot burst and attempting to counteract magical fires.
results.20-20: Spell Surge You immediately cast any spell in your repertoire of the surge's spell level or lower (or from your prepared spells or innate spells if you don't have a repertoire but have been forced to generate a wellspring surge). You must choose a spell that takes 3 or fewer actions to cast.

results.56-60: Living flame shaped into a phoenix

results.9-9: Fell In with a Bad Crowd

results.1-3: [Landmark] A feature of some significance that distinguishes the hex as noteworthy.
results.4-6: [Secret] The hex contains a secret the party uncovers upon exploring the hex.
results.7-9: [Resource] The hex contains some valuable resource appropriate to the terrain.
results.10-20: [Standard] A standard representation of the terrain type.

Deck of Many Things.name: Deck of Many Things
Deck of Many Things.description: These 22 cards of heavy vellum, usually stored in a box or a pouch, bear images or glyphs depicting symbols of magical power. Looking at a card without activating it shows the card face but has no magical effect. Once the deck is face down, the cards randomize themselves-if you look at the top card multiple times, you may find it changes. Any card removed from the deck goes missing after a few seconds, reappearing in the deck.

results.1-1: Balance. Your alignment changes to a radically different one. If you fail to adhere to that alignment, you lose a level and all the benefits you gained at that level. Your XP total doesn't change when you lose a level this way.
results.2-2: Comet. If you alone defeat the next low-threat or harder hostile enemy or enemies you encounter, you gain enough XP to reach the next level. Otherwise, you gain no benefit.
results.3-3: Donjon. You're imprisoned by a 10th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2CNqkt2s2IYkVnv6]{Imprisonment} ritual. This uses the prison option, typically sequestering you in a distant part of the world. You also lose all your items. Cease drawing cards.
results.4-4: Dullard. Immediately reduce your Intelligence score by [[/r {1d4+1} #Dullard Intelligence Decrease]]{1d4+1}. You can then draw an additional card, and the Dullard card then disappears forever.
results.5-5: Euryale (curse). A medusa's image curses you with a permanent -1 status penalty to all saving throws. This can be removed by only a deity or the Fates card. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.8ersuvNJXX00XaIQ]{Effect: Euryale (Curse) Card}
results.6-6: The Fates. The Fates respin the fabric of reality to save you from any situation you choose. This can reverse even a past event, and you can make the decision instantly even if the event would slay you. This intervention saves only you, not anyone else affected by the event. There's no limit on how long you can wait before using this effect.
results.7-7: Flames. A fiend becomes filled with anger, jealousy, envy, or some other reason to despise you. Its hatred for you doesn't cease until either it or you is dead. It attacks you or otherwise attempts to foil you within [[/r 1d20 #days]]{1d20 days}. The GM determines the specifics of the fiend.
results.8-8: Fool. You lose [[/r 1d10*100 #XP]]{1d10*100 XP} unless you choose to draw two more cards.
results.9-9: Gem. Gain your choice of 25 pieces of jewelry worth 200 gp each or 50 gems worth 100 gp each.
results.10-10: Jester. You can either draw two more cards or gain [[/r 1d10*100 #XP]]{1d10*100 XP}. The card then disappears forever.
results.11-11: Key. Gain a magic weapon of 12th level or higher. The GM determines the item and what runes it has, if any.
results.12-12: Knight. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.npc-gallery.Actor.B13dyXTo1xWVyj2R]{Palace Guard} arrives and swears unfailing loyalty to you.
results.13-13: Moon. Roll [[/r {1d4} #Wishes]]{1d4} to determine how many wishes the card grants you, which also affects the phase of the moon depicted on the card (1: crescent moon; 2: half moon; 3: gibbous moon; 4: full moon). These wishes each take one action to speak and have the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} spell.
results.14-14: Rogue. One NPC ally becomes filled with hatred and immediately turns against you forever. The NPC might keep this hatred secret until an opportune moment.
results.15-15: Ruin. You lose all your nonmagical possessions, including any wealth and property.
results.16-16: Skull. You must immediately battle a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.pkNWilK2pHZ5TDsd]{Lesser Death}. If slain in the battle, you can never be revived, except by a deity.
results.17-17: Star. Gain an ability boost you must use immediately on one ability score of your choice.
results.18-18: Sun. Gain 1,000 XP and a beneficial permanent magic item of 6th to 11th level, chosen by the GM.
results.19-19: Talons. All your magic items disappear permanently, except for the deck and any artifact of higher level than the deck.
results.20-20: Throne. You gain a permanent +4 status bonus to Diplomacy checks, and you now own a small castle in any open area you wish. You must choose its location within 1 hour.  @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.Zb8RYgmzCI6fQE0o]{Effect: Throne Card}
results.21-21: Vizier. Upon request, you can learn the solution to any one problem or the correct answer to any one question, unless that information is obscured by a deity. This doesn't necessarily give you the means to act on that solution. You have 1 year to take the vizier's advice or lose its benefits.
results.22-22: The Void. Your mind becomes trapped forever. This card is fickle, but it often throws the psyche into a prison in an object on a distant plane or planet. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} or similarly powerful magic can reveal your psyche's location, but it doesn't bring you back. Your comatose body continues to function. Cease drawing cards.

results.6-10: Ancient dragon skull etched with mystic sigils
results.11-15: Original manuscript from a world‑famous author
results.26-30: Jet and white gold game set
results.36-40: Gold urn with scenes of judgment
results.51-55: Gold mask of a high priest
results.66-70: Intricate silver and gold music box

Rod of Wonder.name: Rod of Wonder
Rod of Wonder.description: This peculiar rod is strange and unpredictable. Each time it is activated, it produces one of a variety of effects at random.

results.1-3: Leaves grow from the target; they last 24 hours
results.10-13: A stream of 600 large and colorful butterflies pours forth, fluttering in a 20-foot burst for 2 rounds; creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} while in the cloud of butterflies
results.14-15: All the target's weapons animate with the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DCPsilr8wbPXxTUv]{Dancing} rune
results.26-29: Grass grows in a 60-foot cone in front of the rod, or existing grass grows at 10 × normal rate
results.30-30: Target turns blue, green, or purple with an unlimited duration
results.32-34: Heavy rain falls in a 60-foot radius around you for 1 round
results.39-39: Summon an ineffective mouse (1st-level summon animal)
results.43-44: The rod casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.j8vIoIEWElvpwkcI]{Mirror Image} on you
results.47-48: The non-living, unattended object closest to the target (up to 30 cubic feet in size) turns ethereal for an unlimited duration
results.54-54: You turn blue, green, or purple with an unlimited duration
results.55-59: The rod casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl]{Pest Form} on you, lasting [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}
results.60-61: [[/r 1d4*10 #gems]]{1d4*10 gems}, each worth 1 sp, shoot from the rod, dealing [[/r 1[piercing]]]{1 piercing damage} to each creature in a 15-foot cone
results.78-80: Roll again; the target believes you created the effect of the second roll
results.85-87: Target is coated in nectar, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round
results.98-100: The rod casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PjhUmyKnq6K5uDby]{Shrink} on you, lasting 1 day

results.91-96: +2 greater striking Handwraps of Mighty Blows

Warpwaves.name: Warpwaves
Warpwaves.description:
Many proteans can subject their foes to disorienting alterations perceived in time and space by creating ripples of unstable reality in the environment called warpwaves.

When a creature fails its saving throw and is affected by a warpwave, roll 1d8 and consult the table below for the specific effect on that creature.

Unless indicated otherwise, a warpwave effect lasts for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, and a new warpwave effect negates any previous warpwave effect already affecting a creature.

results.2-2: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and gains [[/r 4d6 #Temporary Hit Points]]{4d6 temporary Hit Points}

results.51-55: Chrysoberyl symbol of an evil eye
